page.title: 11EDUCATION IN CROSTON
page.content: {Primary:}The Methodist school has 40 pupils and 2 teachers. The CofE school has 193 pupils,the infant section in the original building by the church and the junior section in the grounds of the High school. {Secondary:}The Bishop Rawstorne High School,named after a former Rector of Croston and Bishop of Blackburn, was opened in 1960 as a sec. mod. for 250 pupils.With{R.O.S.L.A.}numbers grew and new buildings were built.Now 733 pupils attend but, because of the {decline in birth rate,}numbers are decreasing.Originally important in uniting nearby villages isolated from each other, Croston children now rely heavily on the school as other schools are 6miles away.They now have a{choice of state and church schools in the Chorley and Leyland area.A small number attend private schools outside.
